title: BDO partners set for £602k payday amid strong sales and profit growth
text:
BDO partners are set for a £602,000 payday following a year of strong sales and profit growth, marking the latest in a string of bumper payouts for Britain’s top accounts.

After reporting a 25pc increase in yearly revenues to £578m and a 26pc profit bump to £134m, Britain’s fifth largest accountancy firm confirmed it would grant its partners an 8.7pc hike in annual pay.

Paul Eagland, managing partner at BDO, said he knew the average pay per partner marked a “significant amount of earnings for anybody”, but that it was something the firm had tried to be “respectful” of as the audit industry faces an increasing number of calls for urgent reform.
